page.title: 14Politics
page.content: Ewelme has a Parish Council which comes under the larger South Oxfordshire District council. There is a Chairman of the Council at present a lady. She sees the task of the Council as looking after the interests of the village. The six people who are on the council meet every two months in the village hall. They discuss items such as Finance, Sports Clubs, the use of the Common for grazing and other purposes, sitting for Travellers, and the use of land for gravel pits. Money is mainly raised from two sources, the fees from grazing, and the raising of rates. A recent rate increase was levied to help pay for the new Village Hall. Elections take place every four years.
